Title: Senior Associate, Labor Planning
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of our Final Mile Center in City of Industry, CA. 
The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

The salary range for this position is $85,500 - $94,500 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per individual states pay transparency laws.

Title: Warehouse Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Shift: Tuesday - Friday 9:30 PM - 8 AM
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Weve been busy building a best-in-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset-based warehouses. Supervise the functions and working of the warehouse workers.
Delegate and assign tasks and targets and evaluate the work of the staff.

Organize and conduct necessary training activities for the staff and workers.

Additional responsibilities as assigned.

Bachelors or associate degree in management, administration, supply chain, customer service, or 5+ years working experience in product distribution to customer base.
Knowledge of the safety and legal documentation processes for handling related warehouse activities (MSDS, Equipment checklist, BOL).
Working understanding of Warehouse Management System.
Should have excellent leadership and administration skills and abilities.
Strong motivational, effectual team building, and decision-making skills.
Ability to effectively manage time and resolve crises.
Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
Ability to work overtime as needed.

Title: ML Scientist, Advertising Optimization & Automation
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we areWayfairs Advertising business is rapidly expanding, adding hundreds of millions of dollars in profits to Wayfair. We are building Sponsored Products, Display & Video Ad offerings that cater to a variety of Advertiser goals while showing highly relevant and engaging Ads to millions of customers. We are evolving our Ads Platform to empower advertisers across all sophistication levels to grow their business on Wayfair at a strong, positive ROI and are leveraging state of the art Machine Learning techniques.
The Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team is central to this effort. We leverage machine learning and generative AI to streamline campaign workflows, delivering impactful recommendations on budget allocation, target Return on Ad Spend (tROAS), and SKU selection. Additionally, we are developing intelligent systems for creative optimization and exploring agentic frameworks to further simplify and enhance advertiser interactions.
We are looking for Machine Learning Scientists to join the Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team. In this role, you will be responsible for the development of budget, tROAS and SKU recommendations and other machine learning capabilities supporting our ads business. You will work closely with other scientists, as well as members of our internal Product and Engineering teams, to apply your engineering and machine learning skills to solve some of our most impactful and intellectually challenging problems to directly impact Wayfairs revenue.
What youll do

Design, build, deploy and refine large-scale machine learning models and algorithmic decision-making systems that solve real-world problems for customers
Work cross-functionally with commercial stakeholders to understand business problems or opportunities and develop appropriately scoped analytical solutions
Collaborate closely with various engineering, infrastructure, and machine learning platform teams to ensure adoption of best-practices in how we build and deploy scalable machine learning services
Identify new opportunities and insights from the data (where can the models be improved? What is the projected ROI of a proposed modification?)
Be obsessed with the customer and maintain a customer-centric lens in how we frame, approach, and ultimately solve every problem we work on.

What youll need

3+ years of industry experience with a Bachelor/ Masters degree or minimum of 1-2 years of industry experience with PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
Proficiency in Python or one other high-level programming language
Solid hands-on expertise deploying machine learning solutions into production
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and machine learning algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiastic about continuous learning

Nice to have

Experience with Python machine learning ecosystem (numpy, pandas, sklearn, XGBoost, etc.) and/or Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML)
Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), machine learning model development frameworks, machine learning orchestration tools (Airflow, Kubeflow or MLFlow)
Experience in information retrieval, query/intent understanding, search ranking, recommender systems etc.
Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.

Our Tech Talent team is the strategic arm of Wayfairs People function. We activate business strategy through our greatest assetour peopleby designing, implementing, and scaling programs that attract, grow, and retain top technical talent. Strategic Operator: Owns and executes a holistic people strategy that aligns to business goals, using the right mix of org design, workforce planning, and talent levers to drive impact.

Strong analytical acumen; comfort with HRIS (e.g., Workday) and data visualization tools (e.g. Visier)
Working knowledge of U.S. and Canadian employment law and core HR disciplines (e.g. Talent/Employee Relations, Total Rewards/Compensation, Talent Acquisition, Purpose & Inclusion, etc.)

Advanced degree or HR certification (PHR, SHRMCP/SCP, CHRL)

As the IT Service Desk Manager, you will be the driving force behind ensuring our employees receive exceptional technical assistance in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivating team leader who has a proven track record of providing excellent team leadership and customer service skills and thrives on providing high-quality support. Your primary goal will be to maintain a high bar and by ensuring consistent and top-notch technical support while fostering the growth and development of the help desk team.

 As the IT Service Desk Manager, you will face an array of responsibilities and challenges, including:

Demonstrated ability to motivate, develop, and direct team members, fostering a positive and growth-oriented work environment.
Experience working in a fast-paced, cross-functional, and multi-team environment, where adaptability and collaboration are key.
Capacity to work independently, receiving direction and producing results in a timely manner with minimal oversight.
Strong prioritization skills, enabling you to meet deadlines while consistently delivering high-quality outcomes.

Title: Software Engineer III, Security Operations Center
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair is the online leader for home furnishings and decor. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 8 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares and more. 
Wayfair operates a growing Security Operations Center and were looking for a talented Security Engineer to join and help grow our team. Our Security Operations team is tasked with monitoring and protecting Wayfair from an ever growing number of security risks, and finding new and creative ways to do so. We have a strong focus on engineering and innovation, and are seeking individuals who love to find new problems and hate fixing the same problem twice.
What Youll Need

6+ years experience working in cyber security operations
Thorough understanding of the threat landscape, the latest security trends, attack vectors for corporate and cloud environments, and how build detection and response tooling to identify and respond to malicious actors
Experience with building and scaling SOAR/SIEM technologies
Experience with incident detection and remediation
Strong working knowledge of threat vectors, vulnerabilities, and what anomalies to look for
Strong working knowledge of Linux and/or Windows logs & indicators
Python experience to build and automate tooling
Experience writing SIEM logging parsing rules
Hands-on experience with incident response and monitoring tools, such as SIEM, EDR, cloud monitoring, etc.
Strong communication skills, especially the ability to communicate security risks in business rather than purely engineering
Strong understanding of cyber security best practices and frameworks such as NIST, MITRE, ATT&CK Framework, and OWASP Top 10

What Youll Do

In this role you will work closely with the cyber security organization to build monitoring and response tooling and processes to reduce our mean-time-to-detect and remediate to keep up with threat actors changing tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
Logging - Get all security relevant cloud, infrastructure and application logs parsed, and  into our SIEM
Detection - Setup detection and prevention rules and policies, PoC and deploy tools that help with detection, tune/audit deployed rules/policies in security tools on true and false positives, setting up a detection framework
Response - Build plan and procedures for Incident Response, create playbooks to be followed, automate response, develop/deploy malware analysis tools and techniques, forensic tools and techniques to capture evidence/malware, PoC and deploy tools that help with response, integrate with customer service teams and engineering teams etc.
Build security alerts & dashboards in various incident response tools. Monitor for suspicious activities/alerts in the cloud/infrastructure/application from various sources such as internal reports from employees as well as external reports such as customers/social media, vendors, partners, bug bounty programs etc., deployed/integrated security tools, data visualization tools etc.
Support tooling to help analyze suspicious activities/alerts including malware analysis and forensics
Build and maintain security infrastructure tooling that supports continuous SOC operations and vulnerability management 
As needed, support the response to security alerts and incidents, and take appropriate action to remediate and resolve

Title: Senior Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops
RoleDescription:
Senior Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops - Wayfair Branded Stores
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation starts at $21.00/hour for this role.
Overview:
As a Senior Specialist of Inventory & Logistics, youll play a critical role in driving operational excellence and ensuring seamless inventory and supply chain processes within Wayfairs Physical Retail store in Wilmette. Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Leveraging data-driven insights and problem-solving expertise, youll implement best practices that improve product availability, minimize discrepancies, and support a flawless customer shopping experience.
In this role, youll also mentor Logistics & Inventory Specialists, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and take ownership of projects that enhance store performance. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment, and has a strong background in inventory management and logistics, and is passionate about building scalable solutions that drive retail success.
What Does a Sr. Specialist of Inventory & Logistics Do?

Demonstrate Reliability & Professionalism: Maintain strong attendance and communication to support business needs. Proactively address scheduling or operational challenges to ensure consistent store coverage.
Lead Inventory Control & Accuracy: Own the Cycle Count Program and other inventory control initiatives to ensure accurate stock levels, minimize shrinkage, and optimize inventory flow. Analyze data trends to forecast demand and adjust inventory strategies accordingly.
Optimize Logistics & Supply Chain Operations: Evaluate and refine logistics processes to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve fulfillment speed. Implement best practices for shipment processing, stock replenishment, and overall supply chain coordination.
Oversee Shipment Processing & Vendor Coordination: Manage inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring accurate receiving, processing, and dispatch. Partner with vendors and distribution teams to resolve fulfillment discrepancies and improve delivery timelines.
Drive Operational Excellence & Compliance: Monitor adherence to inventory and logistics policies, conduct regular audits, and implement corrective actions to maintain high operational standards.
Mentor & Develop Logistics Team Members: Train and support Logistics & Inventory Specialists, providing guidance on best practices, troubleshooting challenges, and fostering a high-performance culture.
Analyze Performance & Drive Data-Driven Decisions: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory, shipping, and logistics. Leverage insights to identify areas for improvement and make informed recommendations.
Ensure Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams to integrate logistics processes with broader business objectives. Provide insights to improve product availability and customer experience.
Solve Problems & Lead Continuous Improvement: Identify operational bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions to enhance workflow, accuracy, and efficiency in logistics operations.
Adapt to Rapid Change & Evolving Business Needs: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by staying agile, managing shifting priorities, and proactively addressing challenges as they arise.

What are the Job Requirements?

Education: Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field preferred, or equivalent work experience.
Experience: 3-5 years of experience in inventory control, logistics, or supply chain operations, preferably in a retail environment. Experience leading projects, mentoring team members, and driving operational improvements.
Inventory & Logistics Expertise: Strong understanding of inventory management principles, logistics workflows, and best practices for stock accuracy and shipment processing. Experience with WMS systems and inventory tracking technology is a plus.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop effective solutions to improve efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness.
Leadership & Collaboration: Proven ability to mentor, train, and develop team members while working cross-functionally with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel) or Google Suite (especially Sheets). Familiarity with inventory management systems, order management tools, and scan technology preferred.
Physical Requirements: Ability to perform frequent movement, including standing, kneeling, crouching, and repetitive motions. Must be able to lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs as needed.
Availability: Open schedule availability, including nights, weekends, and holidays, is required.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist -  Catalog Science Foundations
RoleDescription:
The Catalog Science Foundations team at Wayfair drives growth by tackling fundamental challenges ranging from multi-modal product understanding, product relationships modeling, to GenAI-driven catalog intelligence at scale. Our team provides the core capabilities that are crucial for enhancing the customer browse experience (e.g., visual search, recommendations), streamlining supplier product onboarding (e.g., product classification, image and content tagging), informing catalog competitiveness, and ultimately delivering significant impact for our customers, suppliers, and Wayfair.
We are looking for a strong Machine Learning Scientist with deep technical expertise and a proactive, action-oriented mindset. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and refining the advanced models and systems that power our core mission. You will contribute to a diverse range of initiatives by applying cutting-edge deep learning techniques, vision-language models, and Generative AI agentic workflows. You will work in close collaboration with a highly capable, cross-functional team to tackle complex, high-impact challenges and help pioneer innovative solutions.
If you are passionate about working on cutting-edge AI problems, building scalable machine learning systems that solve real-world challenges, and directly contributing to significant business impact, this is the role for you.
What youll do:

Research and experiment with state-of-the-art multi-modal understanding techniques and algorithms. Design and implement evaluation strategies applied to real-world scenarios tailored to Wayfair use cases.
Leverage and fine-tune LLMs (e.g., OpenAI GPT, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, Open Source) to build AI-driven classifiers, product taggers, and quality control mechanisms.
Develop and refine the visual search system leveraging cutting edge technologies in computer vision, vision language models, and the large scale data orchestration.
Implement AI-powered automation for product data structuring, attribute extraction, and metadata validationensuring our catalog remains accurate, complete, and scalable.
Collaborate with top AI research and industry leaders (e.g., Google, Anthropic, Snorkel AI) to explore cutting-edge techniques in LLMs, data labeling automation, and scalable ML workflows.
Develop agentic AI workflows for automated schema definition, dataset generation, production relationship modeling, and LLM-based judgment systems to validate catalog data.
Partner with cross-functional teams across engineering, scientists, and product to ensure AI solutions integrate seamlessly into catalog systems.
Optimize cost, efficiency, and scalability of AI models, leveraging parameter-efficient fine-tuning (LoRA, QLoRA), knowledge distillation, and hybrid ML approaches.

Who you are:

PhD with 0-1+ years of experience or Masters in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related quantitative field with 2+ years of full-time industry experience in applied research.
Proven track record of delivering successful machine learning projects from conception to production, demonstrating strong deployment, problem-solving, and maintenance skills.
Deep understanding of both traditional Machine learning approaches and deep learning techniques, reinforcement learning, and multi-modal understanding. 
Deep understanding of LLMs, generative AI, and fine-tuning techniques, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques,  with hands-on experience using models like GPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.
Deep understanding of data engineering concepts with experience in building scalable data pipelines for collecting, processing, and transforming data.
Professional coding expertise in languages like Python and Go, proficiency in SQL, and experience with data visualization tools; skilled in using ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch) and implementing CI/CD, containerization, and version control best practices.
Familiarity with ML Ops, cloud infrastructure, and engineering best practices (Airflow, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Kubernetes, Spark, Python, SQL).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders while collaborating across teams.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new tools and techniques in a fast-paced, evolving environment, while managing multiple priorities with a high level of attention to detail and staying current with the latest ML research.

Nice to have:

Research publications in deep learning, computer vision, or generative AI.
Experience working in e-commerce catalog AI systems, retail data structuring, or large-scale product classification.
Background in autonomous AI agents, reinforcement learning, or online learning systems.

Title: Junior Graduate Assistant Merchandiser
RoleDescription:
As a Junior Graduate Assistant Merchandiser, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. Your ranges will become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Graduate Assistant Merchandiser, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's or masters degree
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 4 days per week & 1 day a week remote. Sometimes at Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

Wayfair is looking for a Manager on our Procurement Product team to drive the ongoing optimization of our cloud-based procure-to-pay system and subsequent spend processes. Collaborate with engineering to review, prioritize, and action system enhancement requests and reconfigurations.

Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees and executive management.

An ability to hit the ground running and learn quickly; a self-starter.

Night Shift Warehouse Supervisor  Jacksonville - 13483 103rd Street, Jacksonville, FL
Shift:

Wed - Sat 4:45pm -  3:15am (4x 10hr shift)

 
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Bachelors or associate degree in management, administration, supply chain, customer service, or 5+ years working experience in product distribution to customer base.

Should have excellent leadership and administration skills and abilities.
Strong motivational, effectual team building, and decision-making skills.
Ability to effectively manage time and resolve crises.
Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.

Ability to work overtime as needed.

Title: Senior Manager, Profit Management & Pricing - Wayfair Canada
RoleDescription:
About the RoleWe are seeking a strategic and results-driven Senior Manager to lead our Profit Management and Pricing team for Wayfair Canada. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business in the region by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive optimal financial performance.
Key Responsibilities

Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the Canada market.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive branded pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Business Performance Monitoring:

Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Cross-Functional Leadership and Collaboration:

Be a voice of the Canadian business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Supplier Partnerships and Operations teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.

Team Leadership:

Lead and develop a high-performing team of analysts, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and enable professional growth within the team.


What Were Looking For

Proven Experience:

7+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.

Analytical Expertise:

Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.
Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.

Strategic Vision:

Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.

Leadership Skills:

Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Industry Knowledge:

Familiarity with e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.

Title: Process, Audit and Jump Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Process, Audit, & Jump Supervisor - Global Transportation & Delivery
We are support partners and leaders on the Wayfair Global Supply Chain Transportation and Delivery Enablement Team. Schedule:   

Hours for this position are five 8-hour shifts per week.
Monday - Friday 8AM-5PM, with flex to overnight shifts as needed
At times, will need to flex schedule days/times to support operational needs - including working overnight full night shifts, or working an alternate day (weekends).
Travel 75%  required, sometimes with short notice.

Location:

Role Location Options:  

City of Industry, CA
Linden, NJ
Pompano Beach, FL
Manassas, VA
Phoenix, AZ


What You'll Do

Perform regular audits of HDO Warehouses locations across the country as assigned, focusing on 5S standards and process compliance. 
Present audit findings with network leadership and provide feedback based on your onsite observations.
Follow up on previous audits to ensure that action plans have been successfully implemented.
Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions HDO locations, including new hire orientation, job function training, new process & tech launches, and continuous development.

Use operational expertise to flex to support site operations during peak volume periods, and when needed.  Supervise the functions and working of warehouse workers while adhering to the compliance of all legal and safety procedures.
Work effectively with other managers within functional team and support new team members.
Support T&D Enablement, Safety, and Operations by championing training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Supply Chain Leadership, Change Management OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.

Title: Part-Time Associate, Logistics & Inventory Ops
RoleDescription:
Part Time Associate, Logistics & Inventory
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation for this role starts at $17/hour.
Overview:As a Logistics & Inventory Ops Associate, you'll be a key player in ensuring smooth inventory flow and back-of-house operations for Wayfair's Physical Retail team. Your responsibilities will include unloading shipments, managing inventory movement, and maintaining product accuracy to create a seamless shopping experience for customers. This role requires attention to detail, comfort with warehouse environments, and the ability to handle heavy merchandise efficiently. The ideal candidate is highly organized, thrives in a fast-paced setting, and is eager to contribute to operational excellence.
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Associate Do?

Demonstrates Reliability: Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This ensures were prepared to support our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inbound furniture and other products, including manually moving large, heavy goods. Ensure inventory is accurately processed and documented.
Customer Engagement: You will be responsible for owning and delivering a positive customer experience for curbside transitions, carry-out, pickups, and returns.
Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Use scanning technology to record carton-level details, including product condition, quantity, and location within the store.
Monitor Order Management Systems: Track in-store and online orders processed through back-of-house operations to ensure timely fulfillment.
Manage Inventory Movement: Pick, stage, and move products from storage to the sales floor while maintaining proper organization and placement.
Support Operational Excellence: Collaborate with store teams to resolve inventory discrepancies, maintain accurate stock levels, and uphold Wayfairs commitment to efficiency.
Adhere to Safety Standards: Follow safety guidelines for lifting, equipment use, and warehouse operations to create a secure work environment.

Title: Associate Director, Analytics and Profit Management - Specialty Retail Brands
RoleDescription:
About the RoleWe are seeking a strategic and results-driven Associate Director to lead our Analytics and Profit Management function for Wayfairs Specialty Retail Brands: AllModern, Joss & Main, Birch Lane, and Perigold. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies while also providing centralized leadership of key analytics functions. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts with dotted line responsibilities for 5-6 additional individuals across partner functions (Promotions, Finance, Supplier Analytics, Business Trends, Operations, Merchandising Operations).
Key Responsibilities

Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the Specialty Retail Market.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive specialty pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Analytics Agenda Setting and Leadership:

Decide the key business performance problems that need to be solved for the SRBs; Define end-to-end performance analytics roadmap, outlining the metrics and analyses needed to support strategic decision-making.
Establish functional KPIs and frameworks to facilitate progress, tracking and trade-off decision-making.
Leverage analytics and SRB business context to drive decisions while advancing a cohesive SRB strategy. Decisions include, but are not limited to, catalog curation + assortment strategy, promo strategy and event curation, supplier WSC sourcing / opportunity identification, exclusivity goals and opportunities.

Cross-Functional Leadership and Collaboration:

Be the voice of the SRB business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Merchant, and Supplier Partnerships teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action.
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.

Business Performance Monitoring:

Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Team Leadership:

Lead and develop a high-performing team of analysts, both directly and through dotted line relationships, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and enable professional growth within the team.


What Were Looking For

Proven Experience:

10+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.

Analytical Expertise:

Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.

Strategic Vision:

Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.

Leadership Skills:

Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Industry Knowledge:

Familiarity with e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.  
Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.

A passion for UI, UX, and Design Systems and working with designers to create engaging and intuitive experiences across devices
Experience in working with product managers and designers to define, break down, and collaborate on feature work
A genuine believer in constructive and respectful code reviews, retros, and collaborative problem-solving as the bedrock of a healthy team
Great communication skills and the ability to support technical decision making with the team.

Wayfair is the online leader for home furnishings and decor. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 8 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares and more. 
Wayfair operates a growing Security Operations Center and were looking for a talented Security Operations Senior Manager to join and help grow our team. Our Security Operations team is tasked with monitoring and protecting Wayfair from an ever growing number of security risks, and finding new and creative ways to do so. We have a strong focus on engineering and innovation, and are seeking individuals who love to find new problems and dont want to fix the same problem twice.  
The SOC senior manager will be responsible for leading and deploying cybersecurity initiatives.
What Youll Need

10+ years experience working in cyber security
Experience with incident detection, incident response and remediation
Strong working knowledge of threat vectors, vulnerabilities, and what anomalies to look for
Strong working knowledge of Linux and/or Windows logs & indicators
SIEM and SOAR experience, both building and responding to reports
One or more scripting languages: Bash, Python, Perl, PowerShell, etc.
Experience with incident response or monitoring tools, such as SIEM, OSQuery, VisionOne, Kibana, BigQuery, Looker etc.
Excellent communication skills, especially the ability to communicate security risks in business rather than purely engineering
Ability to effectively influence upward and cross-functionally
Experience with Threat Hunting and building a Threat Intelligence program
Strong experience in vulnerability management, vulnerability prioritization and remediation. 

What Youll Do

Performs and ensures program execution
Manage SOC roadmap planning and delivery
Build a team and capability for 24x7 security operations, ensuring that incidents are handled and appropriately documented and closed. 
Participate in building a security engineering program, working closely with teams worldwide. 
Logging - Get all security relevant cloud, infrastructure and application logs in a parsed format to a unified destination that has good data retention
Detection - Set up detection and prevention rules, automations and policies.
POC and deploy tools that help with detection, tune/audit deployed rules/policies in security tools on true and false positives, setting up a detection framework,  threat intel framework/program, ATO detection program/framework etc.
Response: Build plan and procedures for Incident Response, create playbooks to be followed, automate response, develop/deploy malware analysis tools and techniques, forensic tools and techniques to capture evidence/malware, POC and deploy tools that help with response, integrate with customer service teams and engineering teams etc.
Build security alerts & dashboards in various incident response tools. Monitor for suspicious activities/alerts in the cloud/infrastructure/application from various sources such as internal reports from employees as well as external reports such as customers/social media, vendors, partners, bug bounty programs etc., deployed/integrated security tools, data visualization tools etc.
Analyze these suspicious activities/alerts including malware analysis and forensics
Search the dark web using our OSINT & other threat intelligence tools to look for unknown compromises of any part of Wayfair
Understand the latest attack trend and create detections and prevention mechanisms
Run vulnerability management tooling, prioritizing vulnerabilities and driving remediation of critical issues. 
Respond to attacks on our supplier/partner/vendor, assess impact and take corrective action i.e. identify and respond to supply chain attacks or loss of PII
